ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to combine linear algebra, real analysis, and abstract algebra in the study of matrix Lie groups. Mixing different areas of math together is a good way to review all of them and learn more about useful things like quaternions and affine transforms.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Very good. I know it's unreasonable to expect a TF in such a small class (we had 4 students), but Smilga is intimidating and condescending (in the sense that he expects us to be smarter and is disappointed when we are not) so a TF would be really helpful for asking questions about the material.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Great class. Apply linear algebra, real analysis, and abstract algebra to the study of matrix Lie groups, which is a great way to review all of these subjects as you learn all sorts of new stuff. Very difficult class; do not take unless you are very prepared. Watch out for the final: it hits hard.
